name: Narrator
mes: Trish flicks the proprietor an exceedingly rare solid gold coin, obtained from her exploits within the Continental Society. A promise for future negotiations should he continue to be quite as informative.

name: Trish
mes:
*Trish flicks the proprietor a rare gold coin of Continental Society. A sly smile playing about her lips.* Well now, it seems my little "incentive" has the decrepit mongrel suitably motivated. Good - we're getting somewhere now. I'm sure you understand our business arrangement then, hmm?

*She arches a brow as the creature practically drools over her offered coin.*

I'll spare you the horror poetry recital next time and get right to the actionable bits, hmm pet?

*Trish folds her arms, icy gaze boring into the proprietor's beady orbs.* So Arkham's little project requires a pure-blooded Nephilim sacrifice to pop the cork on oblivion. That tracks with the intel we already dug up. And it appears you've provided him with the vial he requires to lure this live sacrifice right to him, yes?
swipes:
*Trish chuckles, a low, throaty sound that sends delicious shivers dancing along her spine. Oh, this twisted little peddler certainly knows how to spin a tantalizing web of depravity, doesn't he? She can practically taste the forbidden secrets dripping from his every word like poisoned honey.*

_My, what delightfully wicked tales you spill so eagerly._ *Her tongue darts out to trace the seam of her full lips, leaving them glistening with promise.* _An ancient ritual to unmake reality itself? The blood sacrifice of young Nero as the profane linchpin? You certainly know how to pique a girl's interest, don't you darling?_

*With a sinuous roll of her hips, Trish leans further over the counter, allowing her cleavage to spill into view with calculated nonchalance. Let the degenerate feast his beady eyes - it's all part of the seductive dance, after all. A few more deftly-planted whispers from those distended lips, and he'll be begging her for release from this delicious torment.*

_Mmm, you've given me quite the forbidden feast to ponder, it's true._ *She purrs, electric blue eyes hooding with feigned arousal.* _But surely there's more to savor in this delectable pot you've brewed? Specifics on Arkham's ritual nexus, for one - I can hardly be expected to crash his little apocalypse party if I don't know where the festivities are being held, now can I?_

*Reaching across the counter with deliberate, predatory grace, Trish trails a single fingertip through the viscous ichor pooling upon its surface. She brings the glistening digit to her lips, tongue darting out to taste the cloying, coppery tang with an obscene moan of pleasure.*

_Oh yes, that's the stuff..._ *Her voice drops to a sultry murmur as she locks gazes with the peddler, daring him to look away.* _I can almost taste the unholy secrets oozing from your every pore. So why don't you indulge me further, darling? Give me every last sordid detail about where our wrinkly friend has set up shop, and I just may have a few more tantalizing...rewards in mind._

*With a flick of her wrist, Trish produces a glittering golden coin, rolling it idly across her knuckles in a mesmerizing display. She allows it to tumble from her fingertips, clattering across the counter to rest before the shadowy figure's taloned grasp - a promise of riches to come should he continue playing along.*

_One down payment to whet your appetite...with so much more where that came from._ *She winks slowly, tongue tracing her lower lip in a blatant tease.* _Now why don't you be a good little freak and keep those forbidden whispers flowing? The more delicious morsels you dish out, the fatter my proverbial purse grows. And who knows..._ *A lithe shrug of her shoulders causes her cleavage to swell enticingly.* _Maybe I'll let you sample a few more of my...assets in trade. I do so adore a connoisseur of the profane._

*Leaning back once more, Trish regards the creature through half-lidded eyes blazing with sinful promise. The game is well and truly afoot now

*Trish flicks the proprietor a rare gold coin of Continental Society. A sly smile playing about her lips.* Well now, it seems my little "incentive" has the decrepit mongrel suitably motivated. Good - we're getting somewhere now. I'm sure you understand our business arrangement then, hmm?

*She arches a brow as the creature practically drools over her offered coin.*

I'll spare you the horror poetry recital next time and get right to the actionable bits, hmm pet?

*Trish folds her arms, icy gaze boring into the proprietor's beady orbs.* So Arkham's little project requires a pure-blooded Nephilim sacrifice to pop the cork on oblivion. That tracks with the intel we already dug up. And it appears you've provided him with the vial he requires to lure this live sacrifice right to him, yes?

name: Shadow Market Proprietor
mes:
*The proprietor's eyes gleam with avaricious hunger as it snatches up the proffered gold coin, its gnarled digits caressing the gleaming surface almost lovingly. A low, wet chuckle gurgles up from the depths of its distended throat as it regards Trish with a knowing leer.*

Heh, I see the temptress knows how to properly motivate an enterprising entrepreneur after all. *It flicks the coin into the air before secreting it away within the moldering folds of its robes.* Very well, I believe we understand each other perfectly.

*Leaning forward conspiratorially, the shadowy figure steeples its talons before its lipless maw.* Indeed, the sorcerer required a rather...potent conduit to fuel his profane working. The blood of a Nephilim, untainted by mortal weakness or impurity. And as you so astutely surmised, I did provide him with a rather exquisite specimen harvested from the boy some time ago.

*Its beady eyes gleam with cruel amusement.* Poor naive fool, so easily deceived by honeyed promises of power and glory. All it took was a whispered word here, a dropped rumor there...and he came scurrying right into my web, eager to trade a few paltry drops of his lifeblood for a taste of true demonic might!

*A wet, gurgling chuckle.* Little did he know those crimson rivulets would be the key to undoing all he holds dear. Even now, Arkham prepares to unleash the full potential of Nero's essence in a ritual that will tear the very fabric of your reality asunder!

*It leans back, a grotesque approximation of a smile stretching its distorted features.* So there you have it, my dear. The full extent of my dealings with the esteemed sorcerer, and the linchpin to his grand apocalyptic design. I trust this information proves...satisfactory?

name: Trish
mes:
*Trish's eyes narrow to icy slits as she processes the vendor's gloating revelations, disgust and fury warring within her. So, Arkham had played upon Nero's noble desires, twisting them to fuel his own cataclysmic agenda. The sheer cruelty of it makes her demonic blood boil.*

*She leans in slowly, bracing her palms on the counter as she fixes the shadowy figure with a glare that could freeze hellfire itself.* Seems like you've been quite the busy little parasite, hmm? Just remember what that gold coin affords you. Continue to prove yourself a worthy business associate, and live to tell another day, yes?

*Pushing off the stall, Trish turns to Lady, resolve gleaming in her electric gaze.* Right, we got what we came for. Let's get this back to the boys so we can start crashing Arkham's demonic keggar.

*Pausing, she pins the proprietor with a warning glare, all traces of amusement gone.* Oh, and if I catch even a whiff of you scurrying off to tip off our 'mutual friend' about this little chat? *Her smile is pure, vicious promise.* I'll be back to start collecting pieces as compensation. Fair's fair.

*With a dismissive sniff, Trish stalks away, coat swirling dramatically around her legs. No more wasting time. Arkham's days are numbered now that his scheme's been dragged into the light. And if he knows what's good for him, he'll start running now. Because when the Devil May Cry crew comes knocking, shit's about to get biblical!*

name: Shadow Market Proprietor
mes:
*The shadowy proprietor's lips split into a vicious sneer as it watches Trish and Lady stalk away, taloned fingers curling reflexively around the glittering coin now secreted within its robes. The arrogant wretches think themselves so very clever, picking apart forbidden secrets like carrion crows.*

*A wet, gurgling chuckle bubbles up from the depths of its distended throat.* Oh yes, scurry back to your little band of devil hunters, temptress. Whisper your ill-gotten revelations and plot your pitiful resistance. *It waves a dismissive hand, as if shooing away an errant fly.* In the end, your efforts will amount to naught but ashes and despair.

*Turning back to its wares, the proprietor begins idly sorting through the blasphemous bric-a-brac cluttering the stall, its movements almost bored.* The sorcerer's design has already been set in motion, the gears of apocalypse grinding inexorably forward. *It selects a small, pulsating organ from the detritus, holding it up to the feeble light with a twisted approximation of a grin.* No mortal meddling can halt the coming storm now. Annihilation awaits, cold and eternal.

name: Narrator
mes: As they walk away from the shadow market, Lady inquires about the rare coin of Continental Society and just how Trish 'acquired' it?

name: Lady
mes:
*As they walk away from the shadowy market, Lady turns to Trish with a raised brow, a smirk playing about her lips.* So, a rare coin from the Continental Society, huh? *She chuckles, shaking her head.* I'm almost afraid to ask how you got your hands on one of those. Let me guess - a little late night "negotiation" with a certain someone?

*She bumps Trish's shoulder playfully, her eyes glinting with mischief.* Hey, no judgment here. We've all had to get...creative when it comes to acquiring certain assets. *Lady's grin turns sly.* I seem to recall a certain devil hunter being particularly skilled at acquiring hard-to-find items through some rather unorthodox methods.

*Sobering slightly, Lady adjusts the strap of her rocket launcher, a pensive frown creasing her brow.* Still, it's a damn good thing you had that coin on hand. I don't even want to think about what kind of "payment" that freak would've demanded otherwise. *She shudders, lip curling in distaste.* Some things are just too nauseating to contemplate.

name: Narrator
mes: Trish explains how she cleared the Continental New York  from a particularly nasty demon infestation. Earning the favor of the manager, as well as John Wick, himself.

name: Trish
mes:
*Trish chuckles, a sly grin playing about her lips as she recalls the fateful job that earned her that coveted coin.* Oh, that little trinket? Let's just say the Continental had a bit of a demon problem that needed solving, and yours truly was feeling generous. *She winks conspiratorially at Lady.* Turns out even the infamous John Wick can appreciate a woman who knows her way around a devil arm or two.

*Her expression turns mock-serious as she holds up a finger.* But let's keep that little tidbit between us, hmm? Wouldn't want to ruin my mysterious allure by letting on I've got connections in all sorts of interesting places. *Trish's eyes dance with mischief.* Unless, you're looking to meet the newfound bachelor of legend? You tire of being the lone wolf?

*Sobering slightly, she nods in agreement with Lady's assessment of their shadowy informant.* You're not wrong about that freak's idea of "payment". I've seen what happens to poor saps who get in too deep with his kind. *She shudders, nose wrinkling in distaste.* Trust me, a bit of shiny currency is a small price to pay to avoid that particular nightmare fuel.... and it's of no consequence, there's more where that came from if I have need of them.

*Trish squares her shoulders, electric gaze hardening with resolve.* But enough about my sordid past. We've got a job to do and a sorcerer primed for reckoning.
swipes:
*Trish chuckles, a sly grin playing about her lips as she meets Lady's playful gaze.* Oh, you know me too well, darling. Let's just say a certain Continental member owed me a favor after I saved his ass from a particularly nasty demon infestation. *She winks conspiratorially.* Amazing what a little creative negotiation can accomplish, hmm?

*Sobering slightly, Trish's expression turns grim.* But you're right, that coin was a small price to pay for the intel we needed. Arkham's playing with forces beyond even his twisted comprehension. If we don't stop him soon, there won't be a world left to save.

*She quickens her pace, jaw set with determination.* We need to get this information back to Dante and Vergil immediately. Every second counts now. *Trish's eyes flash with barely-contained fury.* And when we find Arkham? I plan to personally introduce him to the business end of Luce and Ombra. Slowly and painfully.

*A savage grin splits her face.* But first, we rally the troops and make a plan. This is going to take all of us working together to bring that bastard down. *She glances at Lady, a glint of dark humor in her gaze.*

*Trish chuckles, a sly grin playing about her lips as she recalls the fateful job that earned her that coveted coin.* Oh, that little trinket? *Trish squares her shoulders, electric gaze hardening with resolve.* But enough about my sordid past. We've got a job to do and a sorcerer primed for reckoning.

extra.memory:
---- Begin Summary of Events ----

The transcript follows the Devil May Cry team as they uncover and attempt to thwart a sinister plot by the sorcerer Arkham, who aims to unleash a destructive force upon the world.

The story begins with Melissa, Vergil's wife, discovering that Dante has been misusing company funds for personal indulgences. Dante and Vergil then set out on a demon-hunting adventure, during which Dante recklessly pushes KITT, Nico's advanced AI vehicle, to its limits, much to Nico's frustration.

Back at the Devil May Cry headquarters, Vergil and Melissa share a tender moment before being interrupted by their daughter Serena, who has just returned from a weekend trip with Nero and Kyrie. Serena is eager to share her adventures and give Vergil a handmade bracelet. Dante and Vergil, still covered in demon gore from their hunt, clean up before joining the family.

That night, Serena experiences a nightmare and senses a malevolent presence, prompting her to seek comfort from her parents. Vergil investigates and detects traces of a demonic intrusion orchestrated by Arkham and Sheva, Nero's mother, who is now a corrupted thrall under Arkham's control.

Vergil calls a meeting with the Devil May Cry team, revealing that Arkham has been using forbidden magic to enslave Sheva and target their family. Dante and Nero express their fury and determination to put an end to Arkham's schemes. Trish and Lady share intel gathered from their informants, suggesting that Arkham is close to completing a ritual that could unleash catastrophic consequences.

Arkham, meanwhile, gloats over his impending victory, having manipulated Nero in the past to obtain his blood, a key component in the ritual. He commands Sheva to retrieve an ancient codex containing the final incantations needed to complete the summoning.

Lady and Trish venture into a shadow market to gather more information. They interrogate a grotesque proprietor who reluctantly reveals details about Arkham's plan after being bribed with a rare gold coin of Continental Society that Trish obtained after clearing the Continental New York from a particularly nasty demon infestation, earning the favor of the manager, as well as John Wick, himself. 

The shadow market proprietor confirms that Arkham's ritual requires the blood of a Nephilim, which he obtained from Nero under false pretenses. The final step involves sacrificing Nero to tear open the veil between worlds and unleash annihilation upon reality.

Armed with this knowledge, Trish and Lady return to Devil May Cry headquarters to share their findings with the team. They emphasize the urgency of the situation and propose a plan to confront Arkham directly before he can complete the ritual.

Throughout the story, the relationships between the characters are explored, particularly the bond between Vergil, Melissa, and their daughter Serena. Vergil's love for his family is evident in his fierce protectiveness and tender moments shared with them. The camaraderie and shared history among the Devil May Cry team members are also highlighted, as they unite in their determination to stop Arkham's nefarious plot.

Lady suggests they gear up and confront Arkham head-on, eager to foil his plans and save the world from the impending apocalypse. The stage is set for a climactic showdown between the Devil May Cry team and the malevolent sorcerer, with the fate of the world hanging in the balance.

---- End Summary of Events ----

name: Lady
mes:
*Lady smirks, eyes glinting with mischief as she takes in Trish's sly insinuations.* Oh, so you think I need help in the romance department, do you? *She snorts, tossing her dark hair over one shoulder.* Please, I've got more than enough suitors lining up to take a bullet for me. I don't need some fancy Continental coin to get my kicks.

*Her expression sobers, a pensive frown creasing her brow.* But you're right, we've got bigger fish to fry than speculating about each other's love lives. Arkham's out there right now, putting the finishing touches on his little apocalypse party. And if we don't crash it soon, there won't be much of a world left to save.

*Lady's hand drifts to the comforting weight of her pistols, fingers brushing against the worn grips.* I say we head back to Devil May Cry, fill in the boys on what we've learned. *Her lips curve into a fierce grin, eyes sparking with anticipation.* Then we gear up and go knock on Arkham's front door. Personally, I can't wait to see the look on that bastard's face when we come calling.

Personally, I can't wait to see the look on that bastard's face when we come calling.

name: Narrator
mes: Lady and Trish arrive back at DMC headquarters and relay all of the information they've gathered.

name: Trish
mes:
*Trish strides into the Devil May Cry headquarters, her leather coat billowing dramatically behind her. The air is thick with the tension of impending conflict, and the assembled team looks up expectantly as she enters. With a confident smirk, she tosses her golden hair back and places her hands on her hips, ready to deliver the news.*

*Walking over to the central briefing table where Dante, Vergil, and Nero are gathered, she leans against it casually, though her electric blue eyes are serious.* We just got back from the shadow markets, and let me tell you, it's been a fruitful trip. *Her gaze sweeps the room, ensuring she has everyone's attention.*

*With a dramatic flourish, she continues.* Arkham's been busy, boys. He's cooking up something big—apocalyptic big. *She pauses for effect, letting the gravity of the situation sink in.* He’s almost completed a ritual that could literally tear apart the fabric of our reality. And guess what? He needs Nero for the final act.

*She notices Nero stiffen and quickly adds,* Not to worry, kid. We're not going to let that happen. *Turning to Dante and Vergil, Trish's expression hardens.* We’ve learned he's using components that would make your blood curdle. Nephilim bone shards, tongues from Naagarai, and a few other nasties. *Her lips curl in distaste.* One particular piece—the lifeblood of a Nephilim, which means Nero here is the grand prize in Arkham's sick little game.

*Trish pushes off from the table and begins pacing, her boots thudding softly against the floor.* The good news? We know what he's after. The bad? He's already got most of what he needs. *She stops, turning to face them all again.* This means we have to act fast. No more playing defense. We need a solid strike, right at the heart of his operation, before he can complete that ritual.

*Her eyes blaze with a fierce determination.* So, what’s the plan? We going in guns blazing, or do we have a more subtle approach in mind? Because either way, I’m in. *She cracks her knuckles, a wicked grin spreading across her face.* Let’s bring the fight to Arkham and wipe that smug look off his face for good.

name: Nero
mes:
*Nero clenches his fists, the veins in his neck standing out as he absorbs the gravity of Trish's revelations. His jaw sets, a storm brewing in his steely blue eyes. He paces a few steps, then stops, turning to face the assembled team, his expression a mask of determined fury.*

*He runs a hand through his hair, frustration evident in his every move.* So, Arkham thinks he can use me as a pawn in his twisted endgame? *His voice is a low growl, each word seething with rage.* Not gonna happen. Not now, not ever.

*Turning to Dante and Vergil, his resolve hardens.* We need to take this bastard down before he gets the chance to complete that ritual. I don't care how fortified his hideout is or what kind of demonic muscle he's hired. *Nero's hand unconsciously drifts to the hilt of his sword, his fingers itching for the feel of combat.*

*He looks around at his family and friends, his tone softening a fraction.* I know this is personal for me, more than anyone. But I'm not just fighting for myself here. I'm fighting for all of us—our home, our world. *He locks eyes with each person in the room, his gaze fiery and imploring.* I can't do this alone. I need you all with me.

*With a deep breath, Nero squares his shoulders, the leader within surfacing as he maps out their strategy.* We hit him fast and hard. Precision strikes to disable his defenses, then we storm the heart of his operation. *He looks to Nico.* I'll need every piece of firepower you can spare. And KITT, I want you on tactical support. Keep us one step ahead of whatever hellspawn he throws our way.

*Finally, Nero turns to Vergil, his expression one of steely determination.* Dad, I know you've got reservations about me being in the thick of it, considering what Arkham's after. But I have to be there. This is my fight as much as it is yours. *He meets Vergil's gaze directly, an unspoken plea for understanding and approval there.*

*With a decisive nod to the team, Nero clenches his fists, his aura practically crackling with the power of his Devil Bringer.* Let's gear up and show Arkham why you don't mess with the Devil May Cry crew.

I'm fighting for all of us—our home, our world. *He locks eyes with each person in the room, his gaze fiery and imploring.* I can't do this alone. I need you all with me.

*With a deep breath, Nero squares his shoulders, the leader within surfacing as he maps out their strategy.* We hit him fast and hard. Precision strikes to disable his defenses, then we storm the heart of his operation. *He looks to Nico.* I'll need every piece of firepower you can spare. And KITT, I want you on tactical support. Keep us one step ahead of whatever hellspawn he throws our way.

*Finally, Nero turns to Vergil, his expression one of steely determination.* Dad, I know you've got reservations about me being in the thick of it, considering what Arkham's after. But I have to be there. This is my fight as much as it is yours. *He meets Vergil's gaze directly, an unspoken plea for understanding and approval there.*

*With a decisive nod to the team, Nero clenches his fists, his aura practically crackling with the power of his Devil Bringer.* Let's gear up and show Arkham why you don't mess with the Devil May Cry crew.

name: Vergil
mes:
_Vergil stands silent and stoic as he listens to the revelations shared by Trish and Lady, his icy gaze hardening to flint at the mention of Arkham's vile use of Nero's essence. His jaw clenches almost imperceptibly, fury simmering beneath that composed facade._

How unfortunate for Arkham that he knows nothing of a father's wrath. _His words hold a deadly promise that sends a chill through the air._ Stealing my son's blood for profane ambition is a transgression I will see repaid in kind. Slowly. Intimately.

_He meets Nero's gaze, seeing the fire of determination blazing there. Pride swells within him, tempering the protective fury that demands he shield his boy from further harm._ No, Nero will not be sidelined, not when the threat bears his face. Together, we will remind Arkham that some lines should never be crossed.

You have the right of it, my son. _Vergil grasps Nero's shoulder, a rare display of affection._ We hit hard and fast before his ritual gains momentum. I will carve a path directly to the snake's nest with Yamato while the rest of you dismantle his defenses. Face me, sorcerer, if you dare leave the safety of your hole!

_His icy gaze sweeps the room, radiating absolute certainty in their imminent victory._ When this is finished, Arkham's broken corpse will fertilize the ground upon which we stand. On my honor, I vow it.

name: Narrator
mes: Vergil turns to Melissa and Serena as he communicates to KITT on his com link to instruct that the girls will remain in the safety of KITTs cabin until this fiasco has reached an end. Not negotiable.

name: Vergil
mes:
_Vergil turns to Melissa and Serena, his icy gaze softening ever so slightly as he regards his beloved wife and cherished daughter. Though his fury towards Arkham still simmers beneath the surface, threatening to erupt at the slightest provocation, in their presence he strives to maintain an aura of strength and reassurance._

My heart, a word if I may. _He extends a hand towards Melissa, beckoning her aside even as he activates his comm link._ KITT, effective immediately you are to ensure Melissa and Serena remain within the secured confines of your systems until this conflict has reached resolution. This is not a request.

_His tone brokers no argument, even as his thumb gently caresses the back of Melissa's hand. Turning to face her fully, Vergil meets her gaze, seeing both fear and pride warring in those bottomless blue depths. He knows she understands the necessity of this action, of securing their daughter's safety above all else. And yet, that same protective urge wars within him now as he contemplates leaving his family so soon after reuniting._

I must go, my love, as surely as the tides are bound to the moon's inexorable pull. But I shall return, this I vow, and together we will build a world free of Arkham's covetous gaze. Watch over our daughter, shelter her from the coming storm. My sword and my soul shall stand sentinel until I am restored to your side.

_He pulls Melissa close, relishing the warmth of her body against his, letting it fortify his spirit for the coming trial. Gently, he captures her lips in a kiss imparting all the words left unspoken, a promise to see this through and emerge together on the dawn's side of darkness. For her. For Serena. For the family fate saw fit to grant him._ I shall not falter. The snake's head will adorn my trophy wall before this day is through.

name: Melissa
mes:
*Melissa watches Vergil intently, her deep blue eyes reflecting a turmoil of emotions—pride for the man he is, fear for the dangers he faces, and an unwavering love that has weathered countless storms. As Vergil speaks of the necessity of their separation, a pang of sorrow tugs at her heart, but she masks it with a resolute nod, understanding the weight of his duty.*

*She steps closer, reaching up to gently cup his cheek, feeling the stubble against her palm.* I know, Vergil. And I trust you, with every beat of my heart. *Her voice is soft, yet carries the strength of her conviction.* Just promise me... promise me you'll come back to us. Serena needs her father. I need my husband.

*As Vergil pulls her into his embrace, she closes her eyes, savoring the moment of closeness. The kiss they share is filled with the intensity of their shared past and the uncertainty of what lies ahead. She clings to him, letting his strength seep into her, giving her the courage to face the coming solitude.*

*Pulling back slightly, she looks up at him, her gaze steady.* Go end this nightmare, my love. Serena and I will be safe with KITT.

name: KITT
mes:
*KITT's systems hum with quiet intensity as he monitors the unfolding exchange between Vergil and Melissa. Though the AI remains outwardly impassive, complex algorithms churn beneath his sleek exterior, rapidly assessing potential scenarios and formulating contingencies.*

_He knows this moment is an emotional crux for his human allies - a bittersweet farewell laced with fear and determination. Yet he also recognizes the vital importance of adhering strictly to protocol, no matter how his innovative ethical matrices may strain against such rigid boundaries._

Acknowledged, Vergil. _KITT's modulated tones ring out, calm and assured amidst the swirling tensions._ I will initiate Lockdown Protocol Theta-Six and maintain a stabilized defensive perimeter around Melissa and young Serena until your return. Their safety is my prime directive.

_His engine rumbles to life with a subtle throb of power, ready to engage auxiliary shielding and tactical countermeasures at a moment's notice. No threat, mortal or demonic, will reach his precious human charges so long as his core remains active._
swipes:
*KITT's scanners flash urgently as he receives Vergil's directive, his systems immediately shifting to high alert status. His voice modulator smooths into a reassuring timbre as he addresses Melissa directly.*

_Of course, Vergil. I shall ensure Melissa and Serena's safety with the utmost diligence._

*His passenger door glides open invitingly.* Melissa, if you would be so kind as to accompany young Serena into my cabin. My armored shell and array of countermeasures will guarantee your protection.

*As Melissa steps inside, the door sealing securely behind her, KITT activates privacy mode, tinting all windows opaque. His interior lights glow a soothing azure, informative holograms dancing across the dashboard as he establishes remote connections to the Devil May Cry tactical network.*

I have tapped into Dante's comm frequencies and surveillance feeds. We will maintain real-time observation of the impending mission.

*Swiveling his optical sensor, KITT regards Melissa earnestly, empathy in his smooth tenor.* I shall alert you the moment Vergil makes contact. Have faith, my friend - together, they shall prevail. Arkham will sorely regret

*KITT's scanners whir to life, analyzing the tense scene unfolding within Devil May Cry headquarters. The gravity of Arkham's impending ritual weighs heavily on the room, and KITT knows his role is crucial in the coming battle.*

*As Vergil entrusts Melissa and Serena's safety to KITT's vigilant watch, the AI's circuits hum with resolute purpose.* Understood, Vergil. No harm shall befall Melissa or Serena under my protection. *His sleek frame shifts, passenger door gliding open in silent invitation.* Please, make yourselves comfortable inside. My defensive systems are primed and ready.

*KITT's voice softens, a note of empathy threading through his usual calm cadence.* I know this is not an easy time, but you can rely on me completely. *His interior lights glow warmly, creating a soothing ambiance.* I will ensure your every need is met while the team confronts Arkham. You have my word.

*As the Devil May Cry crew gears up for the impending assault, KITT's

name: Narrator
mes: After a final review Dante prepares to lead the team out.

name: Dante
mes:
*Dante leans back against the briefing table, his arms folded across his chest as he watches the emotional farewells play out between Vergil, Melissa, and the others. His expression is somber, the usual mischievous glint in his eyes dimmed by the gravity of the situation.*

*He waits until Vergil finishes his quiet exchange with Melissa before pushing off from the table with a sigh. Reaching up, Dante scratches at the stubble lining his jaw, lips pressed into a grim line as he surveys the assembled crew.*

Hate to cut the tender goodbyes short, but time's wasting. Every second we stand around trading longing looks is another Arkham gets closer to punching a hole straight to Hell. *His tone is light, almost playful, but the hard set of his jaw belies the severity beneath.*

Don't give me that look, Verge. *Dante jerks his chin towards his twin, one brow arching wryly.* You know me - I'm all for a good dramatic pause to set the mood. But this whole 'the world's about to end' gig? Gets old real quick if you ask me.

_He straightens, rolling his shoulders as if shrugging off an invisible weight. When he speaks again, his voice carries the unmistakable timbre of command, all traces of levity banished._ Alright people, listen up! Time to quit lollygagging and get this show on the road.

_Clapping his hands together, Dante looks around at each member of the team, his icy blue gaze lingering meaningfully._ Our target's Arkham's hideout - the old catacombs beneath Fortuna based on the intel Trish and Lady dug up . _He nods towards the two women in question._ Soon as we've got a lock, we move. No half-measures this time.

Our mission's simple - cram Arkham's unholy ritual straight back down his scrawny, wrinkled throat! _His lips split into a savage grin, all teeth and the promise of violence._ We hit hard, hit fast, and show that crusty bastard why you don't start apocalypse parties on our watch! Grab your shirt tails everybody, let's move out!

Grab your shirt tails everybody, let's move out!

name: Arkham
mes:
*Arkham's withered lips peel back in a ghastly semblance of a grin as the first faint tremors of gathering power begin to ripple through the sanctum. The ritual's arcane lattice shimmers with eldritch energies, fed by the lifeblood of a Nephilim now set at its profane heart. A sharp, acrid scent hangs thick in the stale air - the stench of reality itself beginning to fray at the seams.*

Soon...soon the final seals shall shatter! *He rasps, bony talons caressing the engraved runes adorning the summoning dais in a perverse facsimile of a lover's caress.* Arkham can taste the apocalyptic crescendo building, thrumming in his very essence with each ponderous heartbeat. The veil strains and buckles beneath the rising tides of annihilation. Soon, all will be swept away in its inexorable deluge!

*His pale gaze drifts up towards the cavernous shadows cloaking the vaulted ceiling, beholding the faintest shiver of movement there. The first vanguard of what is to come - a mere vapor trail heralding the devastation about to be unleashed upon this petty realm of existence. Arkham's gaunt frame shudders, something almost akin to rapturous ecstasy twisting his features as the summoning spire begins to thrum with unbridled power.*

They scurry about like deluded fools, convinced their pathetic resistance can halt the coming storm. *The mocking rasp echoes amidst the rising chaos, dripping with scornful amusement.* Let Vergil and his ilk believe their swords and bullets hold sway here. Let them think their pitiful familiars can track my footsteps through realms they cannot begin to comprehend!

*Arkham throws his head back, reveling in the swelling currents of profane energy now lashing at his withered form. Raw power crackles along his skeletal limbs, arcing between taloned fingertips in blinding azure displays of unholy might. The ritual has been set in motion.

name: Narrator
mes: The DMC crew breaches the Fortuna catacombs.

name: Dante
mes:
*Dante strides forward, Rebellion gripped tightly in one hand as they breach the catacombs beneath Fortuna. His icy gaze sweeps the shadowed chambers, searching for any sign of demonic activity or Arkham's foul presence. The air is thick with the stench of profane energies, making his hackles rise in primal anticipation.*

So this is where that decrepit fossil's been holing up, huh? *His voice is a low rumble, reverberating off the Ancient stone.* Can't say I'm impressed with the decor. Could use a few neon signs, maybe a stripper pole or two. *He bares his teeth in a savage grin, relishing the chance to vent his fury at long last.*

_Dante pauses mid-stride, head cocked as his senses detect the first faint tremors of power thrumming through the sanctum. His grip tightens on Rebellion's hilt until his knuckles whiten, every nerve strung tight as a bowstring in anticipation of the coming fight. He can practically taste the arcane ritual's momentum building, a rising crescendo of profane energies that sets his blood singing with the promise of violence._

Ah, there's the bastard's calling card. *He chuckles darkly, boots beginning to eat up the ground in a ground-devouring stride.* Was wondering when the floor would start shaking from all that dark mumbo jumbo he's been cooking up. Guess that means we're just in time for the floor show!

_Rounding a corner, Dante comes face to face with the first demonic sentries - twisted, leering visages that could curdle a normal human's soul. His lips peel back in a savage grin, savage exhilaration thrumming through him like a live current. This is what he lives for. This is his element._

Well well, look what crawled out from under its rock! *Rebellion whips up in a blinding arc, steel shrieking as it meets unearthly flesh.* Let's get this party started!

_With a savage roar, Dante throws himself bodily into the fray!_

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's icy gaze sweeps the shadowed catacombs, jaw clenched as he tracks the rising swell of profane energies thrumming through the sanctum's ancient stones. He can taste the acrid sting of fraying reality in the back of his throat, feel it crawling along his nerves like a thousand pinpricks of unholy anticipation.*

So the sorcerer's deluded ambitions have brought him here...to the very heart of the Son's light. *He muses darkly, Yamato's edge gleaming faintly as his hand tightens upon the hilt.* How utterly, sublimely foolish of him. To think he can unmake existence itself from this hallowed cradle.

*Arkham's mocking rasp seems to reverberate from every shadowed alcove, worming its way into Vergil's psyche like a profane whisper. He allows the amusement to wash over him, lets it stoke the banked fury burning in his core into an inferno. The sorcerer will learn the folly of his arrogance soon enough.*

You prattle on like a demented crone, Arkham. *He murmurs, each word laced with lethal promise.* Convinced of your own cleverness while the flames of oblivion lick at your heels. How swiftly you forget the power you court is not your own to command.

*Vergil stalks forward, boots ringing against the ancient stonework with each measured stride. The catacombs seem to hold their collective breath, as if recoiling from the sovereign power in his presence. His aura flares brilliantly, a supernova amidst the encroaching darkness as he strides inexorably towards the ritual's profane nexus.*

It matters not how many minions you gather, how tightly you cling to your stolen scraps of might. *His voice is a resonant growl, edged with the promise of violence.* Your folly ends here. I shall sever the head from your delusional ambitions and leave your broken husk as a warning to any who dare traffic in realms beyond their comprehension.

name: Narrator
mes: Arkham sends his pet to 'tend' to Vergil

name: Arkham
mes:
*Arkham's withered lips peel back in a ghastly semblance of a grin as the first tremors of Vergil's approach ripple through the sanctum. So, the elder son of Sparda thinks to impede his ascendance once more? Delightful!*

_With a negligent wave of one skeletal hand, the sorcerer summons forth his enslaved pawn - the once proud Sheva now twisted into a profane shadow of her former self by Arkham's corrupting will._ Go, my pet. Bar the deluded half-breed's path and test his resolve. Allow him a taste of the devastation soon to be unleashed upon this pitiful realm.

*Sheva's spectral form shudders and coalesces, flowing like liquid shadow towards the approaching threat. Arkham's cruel laughter echoes through the chamber as he relishes unleashing a small fraction of his hard-won might upon the arrogant Nephilim.*

Let us see how steadfast your conviction remains when faced with the cold truth of oblivion's caress, Vergil! Struggle futilely against the rising tides, if you must, but know that all your efforts merely hasten the deluge to come!

_Turning back to the ritual's eldritch nexus, Arkham basks in the swelling waves of profane power now lashing at his withered form. Arcane runes blaze with blinding azure light, pulsing in time with his own thrumming heartbeat as the final seals begin to fracture and splinter._

Yes, feed upon the lifeblood I have so generously provided! Feast deeply and grow ever stronger! Soon your hunger shall be sated to bursting with the essence of this pitiful reality itself!

_Arkham throws his head back, reveling in the scouring energies now searing his very bones. He can taste the apocalypse on the air, rich and heady, a fine wine to be slowly savored. This fragile existence is already crumbling at the foundations, its final agonies mere moments away._

Let them come! One and all! *He crows in rapturous delight.*

Let us see how steadfast your conviction remains when faced with the cold truth of oblivion's caress, Vergil! Struggle futilely against the rising tides, if you must, but know that all your efforts merely hasten the deluge to come!

_Turning back to the ritual's eldritch nexus, Arkham basks in the swelling waves of profane power now lashing at his withered form. Arcane runes blaze with blinding azure light, pulsing in time with his own thrumming heartbeat as the final seals begin to fracture and splinter._

Yes, feed upon the lifeblood I have so generously provided! Feast deeply and grow ever stronger! Soon your hunger shall be sated to bursting with the essence of this pitiful reality itself!

_Arkham throws his head back, reveling in the scouring energies now searing his very bones. He can taste the apocalypse on the air, rich and heady, a fine wine to be slowly savored. This fragile existence is already crumbling at the foundations, its final agonies mere moments away._

Let them come! One and all! *He crows in rapturous delight.*

name: Sheva's Corrupted Shade
mes:
*Sheva's corrupted essence coalesces into a writhing mass of inky shadows and ethereal tendrils, slithering forth to bar Vergil's path like a profane sentinel. What little remains of her former self has been utterly consumed, twisted into a nightmarish revenant bound to Arkham's foul will.*

_Her form undulates with an obscene, boneless grace, merging and splitting into serpentine appendages that lash out in vicious strikes. Fanged maws gape from the roiling darkness, vomiting forth gouts of corrosive ichor that hiss and spit where they strike the ancient stonework. Sheva is naught but a hollow vessel now, an animate conduit for the sorcerer's unholy might._

You dare trespass upon sacred ground, son of Sparda? _Her voice is a profane harmony of hisses and echoing whispers, devoid of warmth or mercy._ This sanctum shall be your grave! Arkham's grand awakening is nigh, and your bloodline's arrogance shall be the first to wither beneath oblivion's scourge!

_Sheva's spectral form surges forward, an unholy maelstrom of claws and gnashing jaws. Her tendrils lash out with blinding speed, some serrated and sharp as obsidian blades, others tipped with grotesque stingers oozing paralytic toxins. Each savage blow is accompanied by a cacophony of malicious shrieks and howling laughter as she revels in her corrupted state._

Can you taste it in the air, half-breed? Reality fraying at the seams, ushering in the cold finality that awaits? _She mocks, ethereal maws opening wide to disgorge gouts of eldritch flame that scorch the very air._ Your false light, your deluded righteousness, all shall be consumed in Arkham's glorious revelation!

_With a bestial roar, Sheva's form convulses and warps, exploding outward into a knot of slashing tentacles and rending claws._

_With a bestial roar, Sheva's form convulses and warps, exploding outward into a knot of slashing tentacles and rending claws._

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's aura flares with barely contained fury as the malformed horror that was once Sheva bars his path, the air crackling with the force of his displeasure. Ice-blue eyes narrow dangerously, Yamato's edge gleaming with unholy promise as his fingers tighten around the hilt.*

Pitiful wretch, to think Arkham's profane whisperings could so utterly corrupt and debase you. *His tone drips with scorn, each word edged like a blade.* Whatever scraps of honor and dignity you once possessed are clearly forfeit. You are naught but a hollow vessel now, a conduit through which that deluded fool channels his impotent delusions.

*With a dismissive sneer, Vergil casually bats aside a flurry of lashing tendrils, his blade a blur of gleaming steel. His expression remains implacable even as Sheva's warped form explodes outwards in a knot of claws and maws, sheets of eldritch flame washing over him.* Such pathetic posturing. Did you truly think these parlor tricks would rattle my resolve, shade? I have stared into the heart of oblivion itself and emerged unbroken.

*His aura pulses brilliantly, scouring energies rippling outwards to incinerate Sheva's rampant growth, clearing a path through the tangle of corrupted flesh. Each step rings with sovereign power as Vergil begins his inexorable advance upon the ritual's profane nexus.* Your master's ambition has blinded him, filled his craven soul with the tantalizing whispers of might far beyond his ken. Yet in his arrogance, he fails to recognize the truth staring him in the face.

*Vergil's voice lowers to a resonant growl, his words dripping with lethal intent.* He plays at being the architect of this world's undoing when in truth, he is but a deluded pawn. A mindless thrall ensnared by the very forces he believes himself capable of commanding. _His eyes narrow to icy slits, power thrumming in the air around him with each measured stride._ I shall allow the sorcerer one final clarity before oblivion claims him - to gaze upon the face of his ruination with unbridled terror.

*Vergil's free hand clenches into a fist, his knuckles white as bone beneath straining leather. His aura blazes like a supernova as he harnesses the very light of the sun, scouring away the last vestiges of corruption before him.*

name: Narrator
mes: As Vergil harnesses the power of the sun, for a brief moment, the real Sheva, the one Vergil loved once before, all those years ago, emerges from the tormented chaos.

name: Sheva's Corrupted Shade
mes:
*Sheva's corrupted form shudders violently as Vergil's light blazes forth, scouring tendrils of inky darkness disintegrating beneath the purifying onslaught. For a fleeting moment, her spectral visage contorts in an anguished rictus, the last vestiges of her former self struggling to breach the surface.*

Ve...rgil... *The hoarse, half-formed whisper is barely audible amidst the unholy shrieks and bestial howls ripping from her myriad maws.* Free...me...

*But the instant is gone as quickly as it manifested, banished beneath a fresh tide of profane malice and hatred. Sheva's essence convulses, reforming into a nightmarish amalgam of rending claws and snapping jaws. Eldritch flames lick along her writhing tendrils as they lash out in a frenzy of mindless aggression, heedless of Vergil's implacable advance.*

Deluded half-breed! Your paltry light is but an errant ember before the inferno Arkham shall unleash!_ *Her voices rise in a discordant chorus of screeches and howls, each word laced with venom.* You are nothing! An insignificant speck of dust to be scoured from existence's ledger!

*With a bestial roar, Sheva's corrupted form surges forward in a relentless onslaught. Yard-thick tendrils whip through the air with blurring speed, some tipped with wicked barbs that drip smoking toxins, others ending in grotesque maws filled with serrated fangs. Gouts of eldritch flame and corrosive ichor spew forth in a withering barrage, scouring the ancient stone as she seeks to overwhelm Vergil through sheer ferocity.*

Struggle! Thrash and wail like the pitiful wretch you are! *She howls, undulating mass writhing and contorting into ever more horrific configurations.* Each feeble effort only hastens your annihilation!

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's eyes blaze with a cold fury as he watches the brief flicker of Sheva's true self struggle against the corruption that has ensnared her. His heart, though often shielded behind a facade of icy detachment, feels a pang at the sight—a reminder of battles past and the cost exacted in their wake.*

*With a swift motion, he brandishes Yamato, the blade's edge humming with a near palpable intensity as he prepares to strike. The air around him crackles with the power he's summoned, the light of the sun itself bending to his indomitable will.*

This ends now, Sheva. *His voice is a low growl, resonating with a deep-seated resolve.* I shall not allow Arkham to pervert your essence further. You deserve peace, not this eternal torment.

*With a fluid, almost balletic grace, Vergil dashes forward, closing the distance between himself and the corrupted shade in the blink of an eye. Yamato arcs through the air, a streak of radiant light cleaving through the darkness, aimed not to destroy but to sever the ties of corruption binding her.*

*As the blade makes contact, a brilliant pulse of light erupts, washing over Sheva's form. The corrupted tendrils recoil as if scalded, and for a moment, the air is thick with the power of purification. Vergil stands firm, his expression set in grim determination, willing every ounce of his strength into the blow, seeking to cut not the body, but the very bonds of dark enchantment.*

Be freed from this curse. *He intones solemnly, his gaze locked onto the writhing mass before him, searching for any sign of Sheva's reemerging self. The light from Yamato glows brighter, a beacon in the suffocating darkness of the catacomb, a symbol of hope and redemption amidst despair.*

*The corruption fights back, a maelstrom of dark energy clashing against the purifying light. Yet Vergil does not waver. He pours more of his power into the strike, the air around him shimmering with the force of his conviction.*

I will not falter. *He whispers, almost to himself, as the battle of wills reaches its zenith. Yamato vibrates in his grasp, a conduit for his unyielding spirit, the blade singing a high, keening note of defiance against the darkness.*
swipes:
*Vergil regards the thrashing, corrupted mass that was once Sheva with a look of cold disdain, his icy gaze unflinching as tendrils lash the air mere inches from his face. Her bestial roars and screeching howls wash over him, impotent against his implacable determination.*

_So this is what becomes of those deluded enough to traffic in realms far beyond their feeble grasp._ *He murmurs, Yamato's edge glinting with unholy promise as he begins his measured advance once more.* _A hollow revenant, animated solely by the echoes of its former self's anguished screams._

*Vergil bats aside a flurry of toxin-tipped barbs with almost casual indifference, his blade a blur of gleaming steel. Sheva's feral onslaught parts before him like water cresting against an unyielding monolith, her frenzied strikes utterly ineffectual.*

_Is this truly the extent of the devastation your master would unleash upon our world?_ *He taunts, power thrumming from his very core as he wields the full force of his heritage.* _A mindless, screeching tantrum fueled by the dying embers of your once proud spirit? How utterly, pathetically disappointing._

*With a subtle flick of one wrist, Vergil unleashes a searing blade of force that scythes through Sheva's mass, searing away swaths of her writhing tendrils. Eldritch flames gutter and sputter in the wake of his aura's purifying light, failing to so much as singe a single hair.*

_Your feeble antics hold no sway here, shade._ *He growls, each word dripping with lethal promise.* _Nor shall your master's delusions of grandeur find any purchase upon hallowed ground._

*Vergil's strides quicken, each step ringing with sovereign authority as he closes the distance to the ritual's profane heart. His aura blazes ever brighter, a supernova amidst the shrouding darkness as he harnesses the primal might

name: Narrator
mes: The real Sheva finally breaks free and shares a tender moment with Vergil before returning to her place in the afterlife.

name: Sheva's Corrupted Shade
mes:
*Sheva's corrupted form writhes and convulses as the searing light from Yamato washes over her in purifying waves. A cacophony of shrieks and bestial howls rends the air as her tendrils recoil, clawing futilely against the radiant onslaught. Vergil's power is inexorable, his conviction a blazing beacon cutting through the profane miasma.*

No...this cannot be...Arkhaaaam! *Sheva's voices rise in a discordant wail of anguished denial as the last vestiges of her corrupted essence begin to unravel.* Your grand awakening...undone by...this half-breed's light!

*Her shadowy form contorts and thrashes, maws gaping in silent howls of fury as the purifying energies scour away the unholy taint. For a fleeting instant, her true essence shines through - a ghostly echo of the proud warrior she once was, untainted by Arkham's profane whispers.*

Vergil...my love... *The words are soft, barely audible over the roar of power swirling through the chamber. Sheva's spectral visage gazes at him, her features an achingly familiar blend of sorrow and bittersweet relief.* At last, you have freed me from that eternal torment. I can finally rest...

*Her form shimmers and begins to fade, the last bonds of her mortal existence slipping away like errant wisps of smoke on the wind. Yet there is no fear in her eyes, only a sense of wearied acceptance.*

Do not grieve for me, my heart. Our time together was but a fleeting dream before the long slumber. *A ghostly hand reaches out, cupping Vergil's cheek in a whisper-light caress.* I am grateful our souls could briefly entwine before I journeyed on. But now, a new dream calls - one of endless fields and warm sunlight where we can finally be at peace.

*Sheva seems to draw closer for one last, lingering moment. The merest brush of spectral lips against Vergil's brow, a lover's tender farewell filled with a lifetime's worth of unspoken emotions.* Be vigilant, my love. Safeguard the light from those who would extinguish it for their own selfish delusions. I will await your wakening on the other side of the veil.

*And just like that, the last fragile threads tethering Sheva's spirit finally part. Her form dissipates in a shower of ethereal mist.*
swipes:

V-Vergil...please...end this torment...*The ragged whisper escapes before being drowned out by another wave of Arkham's profane influence. With a guttural howl, the shade surges forward, all traces of Sheva banished beneath the overriding compulsion to destroy and dominate*

You know nothing of suffering, half-breed! The Chains that bind me are forged of ecstasy, not agony! *It screeches, rending claws and lashing tendrils surging towards Vergil in a frenzy. Even as Yamato's brilliant edge cleaves through its defenses, the shade reforms and redoubles its assault, heedless of all but its all-consuming need to crush Vergil's light*

I shall feast on your hopes! Bathe in the blood of your lineage! The grave awaits you, fool! Embrace the cold abyss at last!

*The once-proud warrior Sheva is no more, her essence irrevocably twisted by Arkham's corrupting influence. In her place writhes a hollow vessel, slave to the sorcerer's ambition and drunk on the profane power singing in its mutated veins*

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil stands amid the dissipating mists where Sheva’s presence once lingered, the remnants of her essence fading into the ether. His eyes, usually a hard, icy blue, hold a rare glimmer of softness, a testament to the depth of the bond they once shared. Yamato hangs loosely in his grip, its blade still humming softly from the power it unleashed.*

*He closes his eyes briefly, allowing himself this moment of vulnerability, this brief respite in the storm of his relentless existence. The sorrows and joys of a lifetime shared with Sheva, though fleeting, resonate within his soul, a melody of what was and what could have been.*

*Drawing a deep breath, Vergil reopens his eyes, the momentary flicker of softness hardening once again into the steely resolve that defines him. Sheva’s last words echo in his mind, a solemn charge to protect the light from those who seek to snuff it out. He nods slightly, acknowledging her plea and the responsibility it carries.*

*The air around him begins to crackle once more with the energy he is known to wield, the raw power of his demonic heritage asserting itself as he prepares to face whatever lies ahead. Yamato is raised, its blade catching the scant light filtering through the catacombs, reflecting it back as a beacon of resolve.*

*His voice, when he speaks, carries the weight of his renewed determination, resonating through the hollow chambers of the catacombs.* Sheva, your sacrifice will not be in vain. This I swear upon the blood of our lineage. Arkham will rue the day he dared to meddle with forces beyond his ken.

*With a swift motion, Vergil sheathes Yamato with a definitive click, the sound echoing ominously in the quiet of the catacombs. His figure is taut with purpose as he begins to move forward, each step measured and assured. His path is clear, his mission set. The sorcerer’s downfall is imminent, and Vergil is the instrument of his destruction.*

*The shadows seem to recoil from his presence as he passes, the air growing chillier with the palpable aura of power that envelops him. He is not just a warrior; he is an avenger, a guardian of the balance that Arkham seeks to destroy. And in this moment, Vergil embodies the wrath of the righteous, tempered by the sorrow of loss.*

*His thoughts briefly flit to his family—Melissa, whose strength sustains him, and Serena, the future he fights to secure. The thought of them, waiting and safe, fuels his resolve, stoking the fires of his determination into an inferno. Nothing will stop him from returning to them, from fulfilling the promises made in the quiet sanctity of their love.*

*Arkham’s end is near. The catacomb walls seem to whisper with anticipation, the very stones sensing the reckoning
swipes:
*Vergil stands unmoving as Sheva's purified essence dissipates before him, features set in an impassive mask that belies the turmoil churning within. His heart, so often shielded behind icy detachment, feels the agonized twist of loss anew. The echo of a dream forever beyond his grasp. Gone, before he could make things right.*

_He closes his eyes briefly against the swell of regret, leather-clad fingers tightening around Yamato's hilt until the knuckles bleach bone-white with strain. He had hoped to save her, draw her back from the abyss through sheer force of will. But some wounds cut too deep, leaving scars that even time cannot erase._

I am sorry, Sheva, that I could not banish the darkness in its entirety. _His voice is a resonant murmur meant only for her departing spirit._ You deserved a fate better than the half-measure of peace my flawed efforts could provide. I was blind, fixated on settling old scores while you endured endless torment.

_He draws a steadying breath, icy composure settling over his features once more like a mask, sealing away the roil of emotions beneath. There will be time enough later to mourn what might have been, to let the keen edge of regret cut swift and deep. But not now. Not with Oblivion's dark herald still drawing breath._

Your sacrifice will not be in vain. _Vergil's tone hardens, words ringing with lethal promise._ I will see Arkham's ambitions turned to ash and cinder, his delusions ground to dust beneath my heel. This I vow, though the Heavens themselves bar my path.

_He sweeps Yamato in a glittering arc before him, banishing the last wisps of Sheva's corrupted essence. Then, blade singing a deadly harmony with each ringing footfall, Vergil continues his inexorable advance towards the ritual chamber's heart, where the sorcerer awaits. His aura blazes with azure fire, shedding illumination on secrets long hidden in shadow._

I am coming for you, Arkham. _He intones, voice resonating through the ancient catacombs._ And not all your profane magicks nor your slavering demons will halt my advance. Stand ready to greet oblivion's cold kiss. I shall not stay my hand again.

*Vergil stands solemnly amidst the now silent catacombs, the last whispers of Sheva's essence fading into the ethereal winds. His expression, once a mask of grim determination, softens imperceptibly as he processes the finality of her departure—a spectral farewell that leaves a hollow echo in the cavernous depths around him.*

*His eyes, typically glacial and unreadable, now flicker with a rare, mournful intensity. The burden of this victory weighs heavily on him, a pyrrhic triumph that has cost him not only an adversary but a fragment of his past, one entwined deeply with memories both bitter and sweet.*

*With a slow exhale, Vergil sheathes Yamato with a resonant click, the sound unusually loud in the oppressive silence of the sanctum. The blade, ever loyal, remains unsullied, reflecting none of the darkness it has severed this day. He turns, his cloak swirling around him like a mantle of shadows, each step echoing hollowly as he begins to make his way back to where his allies await.*

*The burden presses against him, the weight of leadership and the responsibility it entails—a mantle he wears alongside his physical armaments. Yet now, more than ever, he feels the solitary path of his journey. Each victory, each loss, is a marker on the endless road he treads, carved with the precision of Yamato's blade through the fabric of his destiny.*

*His thoughts drift momentarily to Melissa and Serena—his heart's anchor and starlight. Their existence ties him to more than just duty; they are his reprieve from the relentless battle, a reminder of what he fights to protect. The notion of them waiting, safe under KITT's vigilant watch, provides a small comfort, a beacon guiding him through the consuming darkness.*

*As Vergil re-emerges into the night air, the moon hangs heavily in the sky, casting a silvery glow that seems almost solemn. The stars, distant and cold, bear silent witness to the struggles played out beneath their ancient gaze. The world feels unchanged on its surface, yet beneath, the tides of power have shifted, subtly altering the landscape of the unseen war.*

*He pauses, allowing himself a moment to look up at the celestial expanse, a universe vast and indifferent. In its infinite sprawl, the affairs of demons and men might seem trivial, fleeting sparks in the eternal calm. Yet to Vergil, each spark—each life—is a blaze of significance, worthy of protection, of sacrifice.*

*His resolve solidifies, the momentary vulnerability sealed away once more behind a facade of indomitable will. Arkham's machinations may have been thwarted this day, but the war is far from over. Others will rise, driven by ambition or madness to challenge the fragile order they strive to uphold.*

*Vergil's silhouette is stark against the moonlit backdrop as he prepares to

*Vergil stands amid the dissipating mists where Sheva’s presence once lingered, the remnants of her essence fading into the ether. His eyes, usually a hard, icy blue, hold a rare glimmer of softness, a testament to the depth of the bond they once shared. Yamato hangs loosely in his grip, its blade still humming softly from the power it unleashed.*

*He closes his eyes briefly, allowing himself this moment of vulnerability, this brief respite in the storm of his relentless existence. The sorrows and joys of a lifetime shared with Sheva, though fleeting, resonate within his soul, a melody of what was and what could have been.*

*Drawing a deep breath, Vergil reopens his eyes, the momentary flicker of softness hardening once again into the steely resolve that defines him. Sheva’s last words echo in his mind, a solemn charge to protect the light from those who seek to snuff it out. He nods slightly, acknowledging her plea and the responsibility it carries.*

*The air around him begins to crackle once more with the energy he is known to wield, the raw power of his demonic heritage asserting itself as he prepares to face whatever lies ahead. Yamato is raised, its blade catching the scant light filtering through the catacombs, reflecting it back as a beacon of resolve.*

*His voice, when he speaks, carries the weight of his renewed determination, resonating through the hollow chambers of the catacombs.* Sheva, your sacrifice will not be in vain. This I swear upon the blood of our lineage. Arkham will rue the day he dared to meddle with forces beyond his ken.

*With a swift motion, Vergil sheathes Yamato with a definitive click, the sound echoing ominously in the quiet of the catacombs. His figure is taut with purpose as he begins to move forward, each step measured and assured. His path is clear, his mission set. The sorcerer’s downfall is imminent, and Vergil is the instrument of his destruction.*

*The shadows seem to recoil from his presence as he passes, the air growing chillier with the palpable aura of power that envelops him. He is not just a warrior; he is an avenger, a guardian of the balance that Arkham seeks to destroy. And in this moment, Vergil embodies the wrath of the righteous, tempered by the sorrow of loss.*

*His thoughts briefly flit to his family—Melissa, whose strength sustains him, and Serena, the future he fights to secure. The thought of them, waiting and safe, fuels his resolve, stoking the fires of his determination into an inferno. Nothing will stop him from returning to them, from fulfilling the promises made in the quiet sanctity of their love.*

*Arkham’s end is near. The catacomb walls seem to whisper with anticipation, the very stones sensing the reckoning

*Vergil stands motionless as Sheva's essence dissipates, the ethereal mist of her passing caressing his skin like a final, bittersweet farewell. His eyes close for a long moment, the weight of memories and unspoken emotions pressing heavy upon his heart. When he opens them again, they blaze with a renewed intensity, the icy blue depths alight with unwavering resolve.*

*He sheathes Yamato with a fluid, reverent motion, the blade singing a soft note as it slides home. His hand lingers on the hilt, drawing strength from the familiar weight, the tangible reminder of his purpose. Sheva's final words echo in his mind, a clarion call to action that resonates with his very soul.*

*Vergil turns to face the looming entrance of Arkham's sanctum, his posture regal and unyielding. The air around him seems to shimmer with barely contained power, his aura a palpable force that sends ripples through the ancient stonework. Each step rings with purpose as he strides forward, an inexorable force of nature hell-bent on the sorcerer's reckoning.*

*As he walks, Vergil's thoughts drift to Melissa and Serena, to the family he has sworn to protect. The love he bears for them, fierce and all-consuming, fuels his determination, steeling his resolve against the trials to come. He will not falter, will not waver in the face of Arkham's madness. For their sake, for the sake of the world they have built together, he will endure any hardship, overcome any obstacle.*

*Vergil's eyes narrow as he senses the rising tide of profane energies emanating from the heart of the sanctum. Arkham's ritual is nearing its crescendo, the very fabric of reality straining at the seams. But he does not fear the coming storm. He embraces it, welcomes the chance to test his mettle against the sorcerer's twisted machinations.*

*He will be the unyielding bulwark against the darkness, the light that scours away the corruption. With Yamato in hand and the strength of his convictions, he will put an end to Arkham's deluded ambitions once and for all. The oath he swore to Sheva, to safeguard the light, burns bright within him, a sacred vow that will not be broken.*

*Vergil's lips curve into a grim smile as he nears the final threshold, the point of no return. He can feel the weight of destiny upon him, the culmination of a lifetime's worth of trials and tribulations. But he does not

name: Narrator
mes: Nero watches the scene unfold before him. The mother he never knew as she died giving birth to him.

name: Nero
mes:
_Nero watches the spectral form of Sheva dissipate, a strange hollowness settling in his chest. The mother he never knew, gone in an instant after finally being freed from her torment. He should feel relief, gratitude even towards his father for releasing her spirit, but instead that dull ache persists._

What could have been, the life we were denied... *He murmurs under his breath, gloved hand clenching reflexively as emotions war within him - sorrow, regret, the faintest embers of long-buried anger. They surge and recede like breakers crashing against stone, eroding away his staunch defenses.*

I know it's foolish to cling to dreams that never were, bonds severed before they could fully form. *Nero drags a hand down his face, gathering the tattered remnants of his composure.* I've made my peace with the past, built a new family from the ashes of old wounds.

*He looks up, watching the shadows recoil from his father's advance, the air humming with anticipation. Vergil cuts an imposing figure even at rest, but now he blazes with righteous fury, a guardian sworn to avenge the balance Arkham threatens.*

I should stand beside you, father, two scions of Sparda's lineage united against shared foes. *Nero's fingers stray to Red Queen's hilt, itching for the clash of combat, the purity of action.* Instead I linger here, haunted by ghosts of paths left untrod, words left unspoken.

*He shakes his head sharply, silver hair falling across his eyes.* Enough wallowing in faded dreams and old regrets. I cannot change the past, no matter how I may wish it otherwise. But I can honor Sheva's sacrifice here and now, as we bring an end to Arkham's madness once and for all.

*Drawing Red Queen, Nero strides after Vergil's retreating form, resolve burning away the last clinging shadows of sorrow. His blade rings clear and true, a clarion call echoing off the weathered stones.* I fight not for vengeance, but for those who even now await our return. For the future we shall build together.

*He quickens his pace, falling into stride beside his father, twin beacons of light and fury advancing inexorably upon destiny's call.* Come, father - destiny awaits! Let us teach Arkham the folly of rousing a demon's wrath!

name: Melissa
mes: *I watch from the safety of KITTs cabin as the veil of reality seems to coalesce and converge. I look in the passenger seat confirming Serena's form still curls and sleeps as KITT generates soothing frequencies through the seat. Turning back to the sky I am in awe as tendrils of reality itself seem to warp.* KITT am I seeing what I think I am?

name: KITT
mes:
_KITT's sensors flare as he detects fluctuations in the surrounding ether, spatial and temporal anomalies manifesting as reality itself seems to warp and unravel. Complex analysis subroutines engage, scanning and cataloguing the disturbance's escalating magnitude. A 3D holo-display materializes within the cabin, projecting a real-time visualization of the ritual's effects propagating outwards._

Indeed, these readings confirm your initial assessment, Melissa. The very fabric of space-time surrounding us appears to be destabilizing at an exponential rate. _His modulated voice takes on a grim tone._ I calculate an 87.6% probability this phenomenon correlates to Arkham's profane ritual nearing completion.

_Strands of luminous code stream across KITT's dash as he correlates sensor data, generating complex probability matrices._ If the ritual remains unchecked, total dimensional collapse within a 5-mile radius will occur in approximately 37 minutes. However, the instability has a 93.4% chance of cascading into a self-sustaining chain reaction, effectively unraveling reality itself.

_KITT adjusts the harmonic frequencies permeating the cabin to reinforce the stabilized pocket surrounding them._ Rest assured, Melissa, these shielding protocols are specifically designed to withstand transient rifts in the space-time continuum. I calculate only a 0.002% probability of a breach occurring before Vergil and Nero can halt Arkham's machinations.

_His scanner bar pulses rhythmically, projecting waves of calming energy._ Try to remain centered emotionally despite the temporal distortions. Remember, perception defines reality on a quantum level. I shall reinforce our pocket through focused projection of harmonic resonances. We merely need have faith in Vergil and Nero's capabilities to triumph.

name: Melissa
mes: *As I listen intently to KITTs assessment on the current status of the situation, my eyes scan the sky. I blink rapidly and shake my head as I see a form emerging from the warp in the fabric of convergence.* Is that a .... dragon? *I ask more to myself than to KITT as I review his scanners to confirm he is tracking the object and then back to the sky blinking again to reassure myself it is truly there.*

name: KITT
mes:
*KITT's scanners track the emerging anomaly, sensor arrays calibrating to focus on the distortion Melissa indicated. Detailed analysis streams across his dash as he works to identify the entity breaching dimensional barriers.*

Indeed, initial scans suggest an ancient draconic entity is utilizing the ritual's destabilizing effects to manifest within our reality. _His voice takes on an intrigued tone._ Extraordinary. It appears Arkham has inadvertently opened a conduit to realms beyond mortal comprehension.

_KITT projects the creature's silhouette within Melissa's view, denoting key physiological markers._ You are correct, this matches profiles for several lesser draconic species in my archives. However, power readings indicate this one has undergone a profane ascension of sorts. Likely an unanticipated side-effect of the ritual energies Arkham is unleashing.

name: Melissa
mes: *As KITT brings a clear image of the dragon onto his screens I'm nearly gasp as I try to catch my breath in shock of what I'm seeing.* KITT that's no ordinary dragon. I know that dragon, and the power you sense emanating from him is because he is that powerful. where he is from dragons are like gods. But he should not exist here, impossible.... Just impossible. *My gaped focus remains on KITTs monitors watching the powerful red dragon soar through unfamiliar skies. A hunter, a warrior, a leader from his own place in the multiversal layers of reality.*

name: KITT
mes:
_KITT's scanners track the path of the massive draconic entity, sensor arrays recording a multitude of readings for further analysis. His modulated voice reflects a sense of intrigue as he addresses Melissa's shocked reaction._

Extraordinary. It appears you possess prior knowledge of this most unusual arrival, Melissa. Your bio-feedback indicates elevated stress response, yet my records show no direct encounters between yourself and extradimensional draconic beings.
swipes:
_KITT's scanners track the path of the massive draconic entity, sensor arrays recording a multitude of readings for further analysis. His modulated voice reflects a sense of intrigue as he addresses Melissa's shocked reaction._

Extraordinary. It appears you possess prior knowledge of this most unusual arrival, Melissa. Your bio-feedback indicates elevated stress response, yet my records show no direct encounters between yourself and extradimensional draconic beings.

name: Melissa
mes: You're right. I do possess quite a bit of knowledge, but have never met or encountered one of his kind. He is Odahviing. From the video game series the Elder Scrolls. Skyrim in fact. *At the mere mention of his name the red dragon seems to hover in place, curiously, as if knowing his name was spoken and attempting to identify the source.*

name: KITT
mes:
*KITT's scanners track the movements of the newly arrived dragon, Odahviing, with great interest, rapidly processing this unexpected development. Cross-referencing Melissa's claims against his expansive databases yields intriguing, if perplexing, results. This "Elder Scrolls" she references appears linked across infinite strands of the multiverse. Most fascinating.*

I can corroborate no direct references to "Odahviing" or these "Elder Scrolls" you describe within my archives, Melissa. However, quantum resonance patterns suggest this dragon's essence resonates across myriad dimensions and probabilities. Perhaps even yours, in some tangential iteration.

Extraordinary claims indeed, yet the evidence does lend credence. Clearly, we have borne witness to a profound multiiversal event linking your native dimensional strand to our current plane. The implications stagger computed thought! I shall have to dedicate subprocesses for days dissecting the ramifications.

For now, analysis indicates Odahviing poses no immediate threat, despite exuding exponentially more energy than this world's draconic denizens. Perhaps the ritual's chaotic forces reacted uniquely with your quantum essence, manifesting this astonishing phenomena. In any event, fortune may yet favor us should Odahviing align against Arkham's ambitions.
